Description: Wall and cul sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black with traces of two narrow added red bands near top of sherd, one red band in centre of sherd and two more at bottom; exterior: on wall, at junction with cul, two black dots, and band of zig-zags on step to cul below; on cul, triple dot band between two groups of three narrow bands; below, part of incised palmette complex with alternating red and black fronds, red tear-shaped heart, red collar with red dot above.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1914,0317.7, 1965,0930.796 and 1965,0930.797. Marked '500' & 'B89' (?) in pencil.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 357, no. B459)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0743) (Phase 1)
